Pre-Game Insights: Hungary have won nine of their last 10 home matches, with their only failure to win coming in a 1-1 draw against the Czech Republic.
Bosnia have conceded an average of 2.7 goals per game in their last seven matches, losing all of them.
Bosnia’s defensive vulnerabilities have been exposed by teams like the Netherlands and the Dragons will have to tighten up to avoid another heavy defeat.
Dominik Szoboszlai is a key figure for Hungary, offering creativity and goal-scoring potential from midfield.
Bosnia’s attacking potential, spearheaded by veteran striker Edin Dzeko, remains a threat.
Hungary are set to host Bosnia-Herzegovina in a crucial UEFA Nations League clash, with both teams eager to recover from disappointing losses in their opening group stage fixtures.
Hungary’s recent form suggests they struggle to keep clean sheets. In their last four matches, they have conceded a staggering 10 goals, averaging 2.5 goals conceded per game.
Bosnia’s attacking quality, combined with Hungary’s defensive struggles, makes a high-scoring affair likely.
